title: On a subscription but still see in app ads
text: - Paid for a subscription but still see ads for concerts, new podcasts, or new subscription plans for duos. This is regardless of the notification settings in app being turn off for them. This this a bug or a feature Spotify? Because this has been around for the last several months with no resolution from support past the â€œgo to notification settingsâ€. Past that, the app is good and is easy to navigate around on. Has more then enough music to find stuff you like. Only recommendation is to make a separate app or tab for podcasts. I donâ€™t want to see podcasts on my music app.

title: My Spotify Opinion
text: I enjoy using Spotify on my console, but on my phone, the experience is marred by frequent annoying unskippable ads that pop up, prompting me to switch to YouTube, which offers skippable ads. Another issue I have with the app is the difficulty in finding slowed/sped up or remixed songs, which can be annoying at times.

title: Ads on top of ads in their podcasts
text:
Spotify, youâ€™re ruining your user experience! I hope one of your PMs reads this and take action.

This ads era is going way to far. On top of endorsements and ads that podcast hosts are doing non-stop (which btw is already annoying enough, but I get it, we all need to make money and producing a podcast is a job and demands a lot of time and research), now Iâ€™m interrupted, even with premium, with annoying ads for random topics. It even sounds like one of old radio commercials - loud, out of the blue and not helpful. It does not convert, retain customers or provides a nice user experience. Rethink your way of doing business. You already charge for a subscription!
